page.prototype: a5_ink_to_png(C ink, N heightInPoints, N widthInPoints, C filename [, L flagUseViewBox [, C backgroundColor]])

argument.name: ink
argument.description: the Ink data to be converted

argument.name: heightInPoints
argument.description: the height of the PNG image in points (72 points = 1 inch)

argument.name: widthInPoints
argument.description: the width of the PNG image in points

argument.name: filename
argument.description: the filename of the PNG image

argument.name: flagUseViewBox
argument.description: Default = *[xb:.F.]*. If *[xb:.F.]*, image will be sized to fit the ink drawing with a 20px border. If *[xb:.T.]*, the image will be sized to fit the entire ink page.

argument.name: backgroundColor
argument.description: The RGB code for the background color (#R,G,B), or an Alpha Anywhere color name. If blank (the default value) the background will be transparent.

page.description: Generate a PNG image from Ink data.
page.discussion: The Ink control (in the UX component) uses a special syntax for the Ink data. The a5_ink_to_png() function converts the ink data to a PNG image.

section.title: Example: Sizing the Image to the Ink Page

description.p: This function has a new parameter that lets you control how the image is created from the ink. By default, the image was bound to the size of the ink with a 20px border. You can set the *[xb:flagUseViewBox]* parameter to *[xb:.T.]* to size the image to the entire ink page, not just the bounds of the ink drawing. For example:

section.example:
dim flagUseViewBox as L flagUseViewBox = .t.
' Include the whole ink page in the generated png: a5_ink_to_png(ink,"300","500","c:/temp/ink.png",flagUseViewBox)

section.title: Example: Setting the Background color

description.p: This example demonstrates setting the background color for the png image:

section.example:
' An Ajax Callback example ' Get ink data from INK1 control in UX Component dim ink as C = e.dataSubmitted.INK1
dim height as N = 300 dim width as N = 500 dim filename as C = "C:/temp/ink.png"
' Red: dim backgroundColor as C = "#255,0,0"
' Also Red: ' backgroundColor = "red"
dim flagUseViewBox as L = .t.
' Convert ink to a PNG with a background color of "red" a5_ink_to_png(ink,height,width,filename,flagUseViewBox,backgroundColor)
